title: FBI Increases Nancy Guthrie Reward to $100,000 and Releases More Detailed Description of Kidnapping Suspect
description: The FBI announced on Thursday that it would increase the reward to $100,000 for information leading to the location of Nancy Guthrie or to the arres
body:
The FBI announced on Thursday that it would increase the reward to $100,000 for information leading to the location of Nancy Guthrie or to the arrest and conviction of anyone involved in her disappearance. 

	The agency also released new identifying details about a possible kidnapper, describing the suspect as â€œa male, approximately 5â€™9â€ â€“ 5â€™10â€ tall, with an average build. In the video, he is wearing a black, 25-liter â€˜Ozark Trail Hiker Packâ€™ backpack,â€ the Phoenix bureau of the FBI posted on X. 
	

	The bureau has received over 13,000 tips since Savannah Guthrieâ€˜s mother was reported missing on Feb. 1, and it said the description might help narrow down the tips. 


	The description was obtained from a forensic analysis of the Ring camera video from Guthrieâ€™s front door . On Tuesday, the FBI released the first images taken from the Ring camera, which showed a masked man with a backpack who was armed with a gun. The video appeared to be captured just before the camera was disabled. 

Today, the FBI is increasing its reward up to $100,000 for information leading to the location of Nancy Guthrie and/or the arrest and conviction of anyone involved in her disappearance.New identifying details about the suspect in the kidnapping of Nancy Guthrie have beenâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/GJcx4ra6wXâ€” FBI Phoenix (@FBIPhoenix) February 12, 2026


	Nancy Guthrie was reported missing on Feb. 1, and the Pima County Sheriffâ€™s Department declared her disappearance a crime on Feb. 2. Sheriff Chris Nanos said that he believed Nancy Guthrie did not leave her house â€œon her ownâ€ after investigators found â€œconcerningâ€ evidence at her Arizona residence.

	Also on Tuesday, the Pima County Sheriffâ€™s Department told ABC News that a person had been detained for questioning in connection with the case and that authorities were preparing a search of a location in relation to the detainee. However, that person was later released. 
	

	Patel wrote with the release of the photos, â€œWorking with our partners â€“ as of this morning, law enforcement has uncovered these previously inaccessible new images showing an armed individual appearing to have tampered with the camera at Nancy Guthrieâ€™s front door the morning of her disappearance.â€

	Savannah Guthrie on Monday posted a video to her Instagram begging for the publicâ€™s help in recovering her mother. 

	â€œWe believe our mom is still out there,â€ Savannah Guthrie said in the video. â€œWe need your help. Law enforcement is working tirelessly around the clock trying to bring her home â€” trying to find her. She was taken and we donâ€™t know where. And we need your help.â€

	She continued, â€œSo Iâ€™m coming on just to ask you not just for your prayers, but no matter where you are â€” even if youâ€™re far from Tucson. If you see anything, if you hear anything, if thereâ€™s anything at all that seems strange to you â€” that you report to law enforcement. We are at an hour of desperation, and we need your help.â€

schema.headline: FBI Increases Nancy Guthrie Reward to $100,000 and Releases More Detailed Description of Kidnapping Suspect

title: â€˜The Pete Davidson Showâ€™: SAG-AFTRA Signs Podcast Agreement With Netflix
description: Netflix has described its recently released â€œThe Pete Davidson Showâ€ as a â€œvideo podcastâ€ â€” and now SAG-AFTRA has signed an agreement with the strea
body:
Netflix has described its recently released â€œThe Pete Davidson Showâ€ as a â€œvideo podcastâ€ â€” and now SAG-AFTRA has signed an agreement with the streamer that covers the production as such.

	The talk show hosted by the â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ alum, which debuted Jan. 30 on Netflix, sort of looks like a TV show. For one thing, itâ€™s available exclusively on Netflix, not widely distributed on major audio platforms like Apple Podcasts or Spotify as is typical for podcasts.
	

	After the Davidson show was announced, SAG-AFTRA reached out to Netflix to discuss whether the project should be treated as a TV show or a podcast. On Thursday, the actors union announced that it struck a podcast agreement. 


	â€œSAG-AFTRA and Netflix have executed a podcast agreement covering â€˜The Pete Davidson Show,'â€ a rep for the union said in a statement to Variety.

	The news comes as SAG-AFTRA on Monday (Feb. 9) commenced a round of bargaining on a new overall agreement with the Alliance of Motion Picture and Television ProducersÂ (AMPTP), of which Netflix is a member.

	SAG-AFTRA didnâ€™t disclose the terms of the podcast agreement with Netflix for the Davidson show. But typically the unionâ€™s podcast agreements have less stringent requirements than TV agreements do. Whereas TV contracts require payment of residuals, podcast contracts generally do not. In addition, TV contracts have relatively strict rules regarding a productionâ€™s safety protocols, working hours, breaks and travel, which are often simplified in podcast agreements.

	According to its FAQ on podcast contracts, the union says, â€œSAG-AFTRA negotiates term Podcast Agreements with podcast companies that have minimum rates and specific terms that may be different from our promulgated agreements. We also have contracts and relationships with broadcast shops and audiobook companies that produce podcasts.â€
	

	On â€œThe Pete Davidson Show,â€ the comedian sits down â€œwith his famous friends for revealing conversations from the comfort of his garage,â€ Netflix says. The guests on the first two episodes of the show are Machine Gun Kelly (MGK) and Charlamagne Tha God.

	The podcast is produced by Above Average president Marc Lieberman and Ayala Cohen (former head of  talent at â€œSNLâ€). Sarah Brennan Kolb directs. Separately, Davidson has made two comedy specials for Netflix: 2020â€™s â€œAlive From New Yorkâ€ and 2024â€™s â€œTurbo Fonzarelli.â€

	Netflix also has an original video podcast hosted by former NFL star Michael Irvin called â€œThe White House,â€ featuring sports analysis from a rotating roster of co-hosts including former pro football wide receiver Brandon Marshall. Currently SAG-AFTRA and Netflix do not have a podcast agreement covering this show.

schema.headline: â€˜The Pete Davidson Showâ€™: SAG-AFTRA Signs Podcast Agreement With Netflix

title: New â€˜God of Warâ€™ Game â€˜Sons of Spartaâ€™ Surprise Launches on PlayStation, Original Trilogy Remake in the Works
description: A new â€œGod of Warâ€ game titled â€œSons of Spartaâ€ surprise launched for the PS5 on Thursday, just as PlayStation revealed a remake of the original â€œGo
body:
A new â€œGod of Warâ€ game titled â€œSons of Spartaâ€ surprise launched for the PS5 on Thursday, just as PlayStation revealed a remake of the original â€œGod of Warâ€ trilogy is in the works.

	Per a blog post shared by â€œGod of Warâ€ developer Santa Monica Studio, â€œOver two decades ago in March 2005, God of War came out on the PlayStation 2 â€“ marking the beginning of Kratosâ€™ incredible journey through ancient Greece and beyond.Â As we approach the final month of God of Warâ€™s 20thÂ anniversary year in March 2026, we couldnâ€™t let this milestone close without giving fans one last big surprise!Â Weâ€™re thrilled to confirm that the original God of War trilogy is being remade â€“ and what better way to announce it than with the legendary TC Carson who brought Kratos to life in the Greek saga!â€
	

	Additionally, PlayStation has launched â€œGod of War: Sons of Sparta,â€ a 2D action platformer from Mega Cat Studios made in partnership with the writing team at Santa Monica Studio that worked on â€œGod of Warâ€ (2018) and â€œGod of War: RagnarÃ¶k.â€ Available now on PlayStation, the game include â€œa canon story set in Kratosâ€™ youth during his harsh training at the Agoge alongside his brother Deimos.â€


	The announcements were made by TC Carson (the voice actor for Kratos in the original â€œGod of Warâ€ games) during PlayStationâ€™s State of Play event Thursday.

	New game â€œSons of Spartaâ€ features Carson reprising his role as the adult version of Kratos to narrate the story.

	Watch the teaser for the â€œGod of Warâ€ trilogy remake below.

schema.headline: New â€˜God of Warâ€™ Game â€˜Sons of Spartaâ€™ Surprise Launches on PlayStation, Original Trilogy Remake in the Works

title: Cardi B Fires Back at Trumpâ€™s Homeland Security After It Mocks Her for Slamming ICE: â€˜Why Yâ€™all Donâ€™t Wanna Talk About the Epstein Files?â€™
description: Rapper Cardi B has repeatedly spoken out about her dislike of Donald Trump, but now the Grammy-winning rapper is beefing with the Department of Home
body:
Rapper Cardi B has repeatedly spoken out about her dislike of Donald Trump, but now the Grammy-winning rapper is beefing with the Department of Homeland Security over Jeffrey Epsteinâ€™s files.

	It all started with her Wednesday night concert in Palm Desert, Calif., as part of her â€œLittle Miss Drama Tour.â€ Cardi B sounded off on any potential ICE federal agents that may have been at the concert.


	â€œBitch, If ICE comes in here, we gonâ€™ jump they asses,â€ she reportedly said on stage. â€œIâ€™ve got some bear mace in the back! They ainâ€™t taking my fans, bitch.â€
	

	The Department of Homeland Securityâ€™s X account then had a scathing reply to a TMZ article about Cardi Bâ€™s ICE comments.


	â€œAs long as she doesnâ€™t drug and rob our agents, weâ€™ll consider that an improvement over her past behavior,â€ Department of Homeland Security posted. The reply was a reference to Cardi Bâ€™s comments years ago about how she allegedly would drug and rob men in hotels when she worked as a stripper. In 2019, she said â€œwhether or not they were poor choices at the time, I did what I had to do to surviveâ€ and â€œI never claimed to be perfect or come from a perfect world.â€

	Cardi B fired back at the Department of Homeland Security by replying, â€œIf we talking about drugs letâ€™s talk about Epstein and friends drugging underage girls to rape them. Why yâ€™all donâ€™t wanna talk about the Epstein files?â€

	Since the Department of Justice unveiled more than three million more files of sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein in recent weeks, several celebrities, politicians and major public figures have had to answer for their past ties with him. Trump is named more than 5,300 times in the Epstein files, according to the New York Times, but heâ€™s denied any wrongdoing and has so far not faced any consequences. 
	

	In the music world, Wasserman Group founder Casey Wasserman is facing backlash over his past ties to Ghislaine Maxwell, Epsteinâ€™s associate who was sentenced to 20 years in prison for sex trafficking. Chappell Roan, Orville Peck and more artists have left Wasserman Group and called for the CEO to step down from the company.

schema.headline: Cardi B Fires Back at Trumpâ€™s Homeland Security After It Mocks Her for Slamming ICE: â€˜Why Yâ€™all Donâ€™t Wanna Talk About the Epstein Files?â€™

title: â€˜Heated Rivalryâ€™ Star Robbie G.K.â€™s Nineteen92 Magazine Cover and Photos Revealed (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Nineteen92 is ready to show off its latest magazine cover after teasing a photo shoot with â€œHeated Rivalryâ€ star Robbie G.K. on Instagram two weeks
body:
Nineteen92 is ready to show off its latest magazine cover after teasing a photo shoot with â€œHeated Rivalryâ€ star Robbie G.K. on Instagram two weeks ago.

	And only Variety has the first look at one of the covers and a selection of the sexy pics from the digital magazineâ€™s February issue.

	In one photo, G.K., who plays Kip on the hit queer hockey series, shows off his body, going shirtless underneath a blazer. In another shot, he flexes his biceps in an asymetrical tank top.
	

	The black and white portraits are by photographer and Nineteen92 editor-in-chief Tyler Chick. Andrew Matarazzo served as creative director, with styling by Peiwen Wang and groom by Abraham Esparaza.


	â€œHe has such a great leading man look, and I think it was really elevated in the way we captured him,â€ Matarazzo says. â€œWatching him embrace clothes that were very much outside of his personal style, and seeing his confidence grow from the start of the shoot was exactly why I enjoy directing actors who are open to going outside their usual comfort zones. Robbie is definitelyÂ starting a new chapter ahead.â€Â 



	

									Tyler Chick
	



	â€œHeated Rivalryâ€ propelled its four male leads â€“ Hudson Williams, Connor Storrie, FranÃ§ois Arnaud and G.K. â€” to stardom within weeks of HBO Max acquiring the series from Canadian streamer Crave and premiering the first two episode over the Thanksgiving holiday.

	The show follows the secret decade-long affair between champion hockey players Ilya (Storrie) and Shane (Williams). In the third episode, professional hockey player Scott (Arnaud) comes out of the closet by kissing Kip on the rinkÂ after his team wins the Stanley Cup.
	



	

									Tyler Chick
	



	â€œFor Nineteen92,Â Iâ€™ve taken a lot of inspiration from old masters like Albert Watson and Peter Lindbergh, and when I partnered with Andrew he really saw the uniqueness of showing the soul of the person in the work,â€ Chick said. â€œI want to capture people, not airbrush away their humanity. Our humanity is so precious and so filtered nowadays, Iâ€™d like to look back at this project as something that was authentically honest and captured who these artists were at this point in time.â€

	â€œHeated Rivalryâ€ is based on â€œGame Changer,â€ Rachel Reidâ€™s series of queer hockey romance novels. While storylines for Season 2 have yet to be revealed by series creator Jacob Tierney, Reid told me in December that she hopesÂ Scott and Kip will be featured moreÂ because of the coupleâ€™s popularity among the showâ€™s fans.



	

									Tyler Chick
	



	More of G.K.â€™s photos will be released on Nineteen92â€™s Instagram throughout this weekend.

schema.headline: â€˜Heated Rivalryâ€™ Star Robbie G.K.â€™s Nineteen92 Magazine Cover and Photos Revealed (EXCLUSIVE)

title: New â€˜Legacy of Kainâ€™ Game â€˜Ascendanceâ€™ Set With Original Voice Cast Returning
description: Crystal Dynamics has announced a new â€œLegacy of Kainâ€ game, the franchiseâ€™s first installment in more than 20 years, with the original gamesâ€™ voice
body:
Crystal Dynamics has announced a new â€œLegacy of Kainâ€ game, the franchiseâ€™s first installment in more than 20 years, with the original gamesâ€™ voice cast reprising their roles.

	A prequel to â€œLegacy of Kain: Soul Reaver,â€ â€œLegacy of Kain: Ascendanceâ€ is described as â€œa fast-paced, 2D action platformer built around vertical movement, fluid combat, and skill-driven play, with select PS1-eraâ€“inspired 3D sequences. Story and narrative are key to the experience, woven directly into gameplay, cutscenes, and world design. Beautifully crafted retro pixel-art gameplay and anime-influenced cinematics bring Nosgothâ€™s dark fantasy world to life, telling a new story set in a vast world of collapsing kingdoms, haunted ruins, and shattered timelines.â€
	

	The fast-paced 2D action platformer will feature a voice cast including returning actors Simon Templeman as Kain, Michael Bell as Raziel, Anne Gunn as Ariel and Richard Doyle as Moebius.


	The game is published by Crystal Dynamics and developed by Bit Bot Media in association with FreakZone Games (A Bit Bot Company).

	â€œLegacy of Kain: Ascendanceâ€ will launch March 31 across the PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X and S, Nintendo Switch 2, Nintendo Switch, and PC via Steam and the Epic Games Store.

	Also revealed Thursday was the trailer and release date for â€œLegacy of Kain: Defiance Remastered,â€ a modernized version of the 2003 action-adventure game with new graphic upgrades, modernized controls and extensive bonus content.

	Published by Crystal Dynamics and developed by Crystal Dynamics and PlayEveryWare, the game launches for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X and S, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch 2, Nintendo Switch, and PC via Steam and the Epic Games Store March 3. 
	

	Per Crystal Dynamics, â€œLegacy of Kain: Defiance Remasteredâ€ is described as a â€œtimeless dark fantasy reborn for a new generation. Return to the dark world of Nosgoth as you take control of both the vampire Kain and his betrayed lieutenant, Raziel, two powerful entities bound by the conflict between fate and free will.â€

	Both â€œLegacy of Kain: Ascendanceâ€ and â€œLegacy of Kain: Defiance Remasteredâ€ are available for pre-order now.

	Watch the â€œLegacy of Kain: Ascendanceâ€ and â€œLegacy of Kain: Defiance Remasteredâ€ trailers in the videos below.

schema.headline: New â€˜Legacy of Kainâ€™ Game â€˜Ascendanceâ€™ Set With Original Voice Cast Returning

title: CBS News Considering New Round of Layoffs, Could Affect at Least 15% of Staff
description:
The axe is still swinging above CBS News.

	The Paramount Skydance unit is considering a fresh round of layoffs, according to three people familiar
body:
The axe is still swinging above CBS News.

	The Paramount Skydance unit is considering a fresh round of layoffs, according to three people familiar with the matter, and the cuts could total at least 15% of current staff, marking the latest move by editor in chief Bari Weiss as she attempts to focus the news division on streaming video and presenting more points of view to audiences.

	CBS News declined to make executives available for comment. Discussions around layoffs and staff reductions remain fluid, two of these people say, and a timeline for putting them into place â€” if that decision is final â€” could start as early as March and as late as May. And while the discussions around personnel have not solidified, they are serious, one of these people said.
	

	Some staffers have already chosen to head to the exits. About 11 producers tied to â€œCBS Evening Newsâ€ have opted for buyout packages that were initially offered last month.

	During a recent town hall meeting, Weiss told staffers that CBS News needed to do less so-called â€œcommodityâ€ news that people could get from other outlets, and seek instead â€œto do things that are antimemetic, that are not imitative, that are differentiated, that are things you canâ€™t get anywhere else.â€ She unveiled a spate of new hires of podcasters who focused less on straight journalism and more on niche fields including politics and medical health. â€œRight now in America, people are skeptical of institutions, but they trust individuals,â€ Weiss said.

	One of those individuals, a longevity guru named Peter Attia, has come under scrutiny because of revelations of tries he had to disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein. Weiss, a conservative-leaning opinion writer who sold The Free Press to Paramount for $150 million, has resisted calls to purge Attia from the roster of new CBS contributors she brought on board.
	

	CBS News, like other parts of Paramount Skydance, has already been through a few rounds of cuts, as both old managers and new â€” the Redstones who backed Pararmount for years, and the new David Ellison-led company that has formed since a sales â€” have lopped employee rolls across the conglomerate. Like many of its rivals, Paramount Skydance is hobbled by a suite of declining cable networks that carry less relevance to video-watchers who have grown accustomed to creating their own viewing schedules across different streaming hubs.

	While there are reasons to shake up parts of CBS News â€” its evening and morning programs have long run in third place â€” Weiss appears to be more focused on making news programming more relevant to people who might find it on Paramount+ rather than CBS. Even so, CBS News programs such as â€œ60 Minutesâ€ and â€œCBS Sunday Morningâ€ continue to have sizable influence and grab good-sized TV audiences â€” and the advertising dollars that follow them. If there are fewer people at CBS News, will the remaining staff be ample enough to make new content for streamers, while keeping the TV audience coming in?

schema.headline: CBS News Considering New Round of Layoffs, Could Affect at Least 15% of Staff

title: â€˜John Wickâ€™ Video Game in the Works
description: A â€œJohn Wickâ€ video game is in the works from Saber Interactive and Lionsgate with star Keanu Reeves reprising his role for the single-player third-
body:
A â€œJohn Wickâ€ video game is in the works from Saber Interactive and Lionsgate with star Keanu Reeves reprising his role for the single-player third-person action title.

	Described as a AAA video game â€œtailored for mature audiences,â€ the title is currently in development for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X and PC with â€œJohn Wickâ€ film franchise director Chad Stahelski and Reeves involved.


	The untitled â€œJohn Wickâ€ game will combine John Wickâ€™s â€œunparalleled, adrenaline-fueled â€˜gun-fuâ€™ fighting style with Saberâ€™s proven reputation for creating thrilling gaming experiences that leave players craving more.â€
	

	The game will feature an â€œoriginal gameplay narrative set in theÂ â€˜John Wickâ€™Â timeline years before the Impossible Task. It will expand on the franchiseâ€™s lore during that time with familiar characters fans already know and love, as well as compelling new ones created specifically for this production.â€


	â€œI canâ€™t wait for fans to step into the shoes of John Wick and explore the multi-dimensional world of The High Table,â€ stated Jenefer Brown, President of Global Products & Experiences at Lionsgate. â€œWe are collaborating closely with Saberâ€™s dedicated team to develop a game that captures the unparalleled action, brand-defining fight choreography, immersive world-building, and authenticity of the films.â€

	â€œJohn Wick is one of the most iconic characters in action film history. Saber is honored to be working alongside Chad, Keanu and the Lionsgate team in a true collaboration to bring the world of Wick to life in a AAA game,â€ said Matthew Karch, CEO at Saber Interactive.
	

	Watch the trailer for the untitled â€œJohn Wickâ€ video game via the video below.

schema.headline: â€˜John Wickâ€™ Video Game in the Works

title: Margot Robbie Used to Watch Rachel McAdamsâ€™ â€˜Notebookâ€™ Audition Before Her Own to â€˜Just Try and Be as Good as Herâ€¦ Itâ€™s the Commitmentâ€™
description: Margot Robbie is crediting Rachel McAdams with helping her become an A-list movie star. During a BBC Radio 2 interview on the press tour for â€œWuther
body:
Margot Robbie is crediting Rachel McAdams with helping her become an A-list movie star. During a BBC Radio 2 interview on the press tour for â€œWuthering Heights,â€ the â€œBarbieâ€ actor and three-time Oscar nominee revealed she used to study McAdamsâ€™ viral audition for â€œThe Notebookâ€ before her own auditions in order to get into the right headspace. 

	â€œI used to watch Rachel McAdamsâ€™ audition for â€˜The Notebookâ€™ before I would go to auditions. Sheâ€™s so good, and sheâ€™s so charming and real, and like, in it,â€ Robbie said. â€œI used to watch it before Iâ€™d go to an audition, I was like, â€˜OK, just try and be as good as her.â€™â€ 
	

	When asked if McAdamsâ€™ â€œNotebookâ€ audition actually ever got Robbie to win a role, Robbie answered: â€œTechnically, you could say any part I got wouldâ€™ve been in thanks to her because I was always watching her audition before. Itâ€™s just the commitment. I always watched it to remind myself that you have to fully commit in the audition room. And I got to work with her in â€˜About Time.â€™ I had a small role, and sheâ€™s the lead in it. I was absolutely no one back then and she was so lovely to me and my brother. Iâ€™ll never forget how sheâ€™d go out of her way to be so kind. I just love her.â€


	McAdams won the role of Allison â€œAllieâ€ Calhoun in â€œThe Notebookâ€ opposite Ryan Gosling, and the duoâ€™s chemistry helped power the 2004 movie to become one of the most centuryâ€™s most iconic romance movies. Robbie did not disclose which movies McAdamsâ€™ audition tape helped her land, but it sounds like a quite a few.

	Robbie and McAdams have both been out on the press circuit this winter promoting their new releases. McAdams is the star of Sam Raimiâ€™s â€œSend Help,â€ which has topped the box office in its first two weekend of release. Robbie headlines â€œWuthering Heightsâ€ opposite Jacob Elordi. The Warner Bros. release opens in theater Feb. 13 and is targeting a No. 1 debut with around $50 million.

schema.headline: Margot Robbie Used to Watch Rachel McAdamsâ€™ â€˜Notebookâ€™ Audition Before Her Own to â€˜Just Try and Be as Good as Herâ€¦ Itâ€™s the Commitmentâ€™

title: â€˜Bridgertonâ€™ Costume Designers on Making the Lady in Silver â€˜Forgettable,â€™ â€˜Sexierâ€™ Maid Uniforms and Benedictâ€™s Leather Bracelet
description: For four seasons, â€œBridgertonâ€ fans have obsessed over every costume detail, like Daphneâ€™s debutante whites, Penelopeâ€™s emerald transformation and t
body:
For four seasons, â€œBridgertonâ€ fans have obsessed over every costume detail, like Daphneâ€™s debutante whites, Penelopeâ€™s emerald transformation and the Queenâ€™s increasingly outrageous wigs. The showâ€™s costume designers have built their reputation on creating unforgettable looks that viewers screenshot, analyze and admire.

	So when it came to Sophie Baekâ€™s (Yerin Ha) silver masquerade gown in Season 4 â€” arguably the most narratively important costume in the showâ€™s history â€” the team made a counterintuitive choice, intentionally keeping the design understated. Arguably, forgettable.
	

	When Sophie appears at the masquerade ball, sheâ€™s wearing a borrowed silver gown that matches the chandeliers in the Bridgertonsâ€™ ball room. Itâ€™s the dress that launches the seasonâ€™s central romance, haunting Benedict Bridgertonâ€™s (Luke Thompson) dreams and sketches. But according to costume designers John Glaser, George Sayer and Dougie Hawkes, the memory was always more important than the dress itself.


	â€œWhatâ€™s interesting is that when you think about the silver dress, we see it when she puts it on, we see it at the ball, but then itâ€™s no longer an important costume,â€ Glaser explains. â€œWhat is important is the image of it, because he draws it. Itâ€™s the memory of the shoe clip, the memory of the glove. We no longer see that costume. Itâ€™s all just the memory.â€



	

					Yerin Ha, left, as Sophie Baek, Luke Thompson as Benedict Bridgerton in â€œBridgerton.â€ 
									Courtesy of Netflix
	



	Rather than create something sharp and penetrating, Glaser and co-designers Sayer and Hawkes built what they described as an illusion. The team deliberately avoided anything that would create a clear memory in Benedictâ€™s mind. â€œIf it was a red dress with a hard red mask, and a hard dress that had a shape, his memory would have been much sharper,â€ Glaser says of the alternative. â€œBut because it was an illusion, like a ghost.â€
	

	The fabric itself was chosen to remain unfocused. Sayer describes layering silver lace, sequins and crystals onto a light silver base, all done subtly so the dress would only reveal itself when Sophie moved. â€œYou just see when she moves, you get this kind of shift, and you might get a shimmer of pattern,â€ she says. 

	The mask, too, was kept deliberately fuzzy. â€œYou donâ€™t really know where it started or stopped,â€ Glaser adds.

	While Sophie drifted through in silver uncertainty, other characters arrived in bold, unmistakable costumes â€” Lady Danbury (Adjoa Andoh) as Zeus, Eloise Bridgerton (Claudia Jessie) as Joan of Arc with a distinctive bob. â€œThose are straightforward looks,â€ Glaser says. â€œYou remember Cleopatraâ€™s mask. You remember Joan of Arc. But can you describe what Sophieâ€™s silver dress looked like? Not really. Silver. And thatâ€™s the idea â€” she is a little blurrier. Youâ€™re not really sure what it is over there.â€



	

					Adjoa Andoh, left, as Lady Danbury, Ruth Gemmell as Lady Violet Bridgerton in â€œBridgerton.â€
									LIAM DANIEL/NETFLIX
	



	Showrunner Jess Brownell acknowledged the challenge of making Benedictâ€™s failure to recognize Sophie believable â€” a plot point that has baffled viewers who wonder how he doesnâ€™t see through such a minimal disguise. It requires, she admits, a willing suspension of disbelief.

	â€œWe definitely talked about putting Sophie in a full face mask, a wig, etc., and at the end of the day, the meeting between the masked woman and Benedict is so important that she needed to be able to emote,â€ Brownell tells Variety. â€œBut I think what weâ€™re really relying on is the fact that class was such a major divide in that time period that even for someone like Benedict, who is fairly progressive, he just would never expect that the lady that heâ€™s been looking for who he met at a ball would be a housemaid. The staff were essentially invisible during that period.â€

	That ambiguity carried through to the ball, which had no set theme or unified color palette beyond a single rule: avoid silver. Guests arrived as historical, fantasy or literary figures in a cacophony of color and character. The designers had ensured each bold costume harmonized with the others while standing in deliberate contrast to Sophieâ€™s silver simplicity. â€œWe wanted her to be the center of attention,â€ Sayer says, â€œbut in the most subtle way possible.â€Â 
	

	Beyond the grand spectacle of the masquerade, the costume team also embedded quieter details that, surprisingly, even the showâ€™s most devoted fans havenâ€™t caught.Â Among them: Benedictâ€™s leather bracelet, a signature accessory he wears throughout the season that many fans may have overlooked.

	â€œItâ€™s the first time any man in â€˜Bridgertonâ€™ has worn a bracelet or anything on their wrist, and no oneâ€™s picked up on it,â€ Glaser says. â€œI find it amazing that no oneâ€™s like, â€˜Oh my God, heâ€™s got a bracelet. What does it mean?'â€



	

					Luke Thompson, left, as Benedict Bridgerton, Yerin Ha as Sophie Baek in â€œBridgerton.â€
									LIAM DANIEL/NETFLIX
	



	The Bridgerton maid uniforms changed, too, with the team subtly altering the neckline to make them slightly sexier for Sophieâ€™s storyline. The adjustment was delicate, Sayer explains, since viewers have seen these uniforms for three seasons. â€œIt could only be a really slight change to the neckline in order to change it up a bit and make it look a little bit sexier.â€

	For the Cavender household scenes, Sayer made sure the neckline was open for practical reasons. When Benedict sees Sophieâ€™s clothes in the rain, the water needed to soak through the sheer fabric against her skin. â€œTo me itâ€™s a major thing, but no one else has noticed it,â€ Glaser says of the uniform changes overall.



	

					Yerin Ha as Sophie Baek in â€œBridgerton.â€
									LIAM DANIEL/NETFLIX
	





	

					Oli Higginson, left, as Footman John, Sophie Lamont as Celia, Geraldine Alexander as Mrs. Wilson in â€œBridgerton.â€ 
									LIAM DANIEL/NETFLIX
	



	Itâ€™s clear that a well-oiled machine is essential for creating costumes this detailed. From research to fabric sourcing to sketches to embellishment, a single dress takes four to six weeks with four to five people working on it simultaneously. The Queenâ€™s dresses, with their elaborate embellishment and grander nature, can be in production for months.

	With only a handful of days to complete it the silver dress required an all hands-on approach, needing an army of people sat around the gown applying crystals, sequins and lace by hand. â€œThere were about five or seven people all sitting around the dress doing the embellishment,â€ Sayer recalls. The timeline prompts Glaser to joke: â€œLetâ€™s change that number to four to six years.â€

	Yet what makes Sophieâ€™s gown particularly poignant is its origin. Unlike the other masquerade guests in deliberate costumes, Sophie isnâ€™t wearing a fancy dress at all. â€œShe wasnâ€™t in fancy dress. She was just in a borrowed evening dress,â€ Sayer emphasizes. Her stepsister Rosamundâ€™s maid Alfie found it in an attic. â€œI thought that was charming,â€ Hawkes says of the narrative choice. â€œThe color was dictated by the fact itâ€™s a borrowed dress, and that gave a lovely, soft story there.â€
	

	Season 4 gives us a Cinderella story stripped to its bones: a borrowed dress, a masquerade ball and a woman out of her depth. The gown looks stunning on screen, but try to describe it later and the details slip away just like Sophie when the clock strikes 12. It persists in Benedictâ€™s perception, and by extension the audienceâ€™s, not as a catalogable object but as an impression: silver-toned, luminous, elusive.

	â€œItâ€™s a little fuzzy,â€ Glaser says. â€œYouâ€™re not really sure. Itâ€™s not sharp enough.â€

	Exactly as designed.

schema.headline: â€˜Bridgertonâ€™ Costume Designers on Making the Lady in Silver â€˜Forgettable,â€™ â€˜Sexierâ€™ Maid Uniforms and Benedictâ€™s Leather Bracelet

title: 'RHONY' Reunion Show Not Replacing Jill Zarin After Firing
description:
'Real Housewives of New York'
                          No Plans to Replace Jill Zarin After Axe
body:
'Real Housewives of New York'
                          No Plans to Replace Jill Zarin After Axe
                      
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Jill Zarin is out at the 'RHONY' reunion show "The Golden Life," but producers aren't looking to fill her big shoes, at least as of now ... TMZ has learned.
      
    
          Multiple sources with direct knowledge tell TMZ ... producers currently have no plans to replace Jill on the E! series after she was fired this week over her controversial statements about Bad Bunny's Super Bowl halftime performance, which many people found to be racist.
      
    
      
      Jill Zarinâ€™s review of Bad Bunnyâ€™s #SuperBowl Halftime Showâ€¦ ğŸ¥´ pic.twitter.com/XH8f0HjQpIâ€” Gibson Johns (@gibsonoma) February 9, 2026
              @gibsonoma
          
  
    
          We're told the show's producers feel the remaining women are more than capable of carrying the show and don't need anyone else to take over Jill's spot.
      
    
          Our sources also tell us fans could still see familiar faces from past RHONY seasons because there's chatter about cameos during filming. Speaking of former cast members, Dorinda Medley has just joined the reunion show ... but not as a full-time cast member, as of now.
      

                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          As we reported, Blink49 Studios cut ties with Jill on Tuesday after she posted and then deleted an Instagram video on Sunday criticizing Bad Bunny's Super Bowl Halftime Show. The clip, later reposted on X, sparked backlash and ultimately led to her termination from the E! project.
      
    
          Sources close to Jill told us she believes she was punished for expressing an opinion, especially when other Housewives have weathered controversies without losing their roles. Our sources tell us she quickly deleted the video after realizing she misspoke and, after rewatching the performance, came to better understand its cultural significance.
      
    
          We reached out to reps for E! ... so far, no word back.
      
      
              
            
              Related articles
            
        
              
          
                          
                Jill Zarin
              
                          
                Bad Bunny

          Sign up for Amazon Prime to get the best deals!

title: Second Nancy Guthrie Demand Note, Last Chance To Pay For Kidnapper's Identity
description:
Nancy Guthrie
                          New Bitcoin Demand To ID Kidnapper
body:
Nancy Guthrie
                          New Bitcoin Demand To ID Kidnapper
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              
                February 12, 2026
                
                            10:37 AM PST
                                                                      |
                                                                Updated 
                                  February 12, 2026
                                3:03 PM PST
                                    
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          TMZ has received another email from the person who claims to know the identity of Nancy Guthrie's kidnapper ... and the words are chilling.
      
    
          As we reported, TMZ received an email Wednesday, asking for 1 bitcoin in return for the name of the kidnapper. A single bitcoin is currently worth around $65,000. We monitored the account all day, but nothing was deposited.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          Just after 8 AM Pacific Time Thursday ... TMZ received a second email from the same person, who complained, "I am not being taken seriously." He makes some ominous statements in the email ... TMZ is cooperating with law enforcement by not disclosing specifics. One thing he makes clear ... the situation has changed from Wednesday to Thursday.
      
    
          As for why he wants a bitcoin ... he says he will need money to lay low after identifying the kidnapper for fear of retaliation. He also worries he might be "incriminated like that Carlos [the deliveryman who was detained and released] guy."
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    TMZ.com
          
    
          He ends by saying this is his final attempt to help.
      
    
          As of this post, no money or bitcoin has been deposited in his account.
      
      
              
            
              Related articles
            
        
              
          
                          
                Nancy Guthrie
              
                          
                Crime

schema.headline: Second Nancy Guthrie Demand Note, Last Chance To Pay For Kidnapper's Identity
